subject: Russ Mitchell: On Immigration and the Bush Administration
body:

Hi,
 
I'm 
      Russ Mitchell and here's a re-cap of this morning's Early 
      Show. 
 
Contributor Lou Dobbs from CNN stopped by to give us his thoughts 
      about immigration. Today thousands are expected to attend pro-immigrant 
      rallies across the country pushing for laws to turn America's illegal 
      immigrants into legal residents. Dobbs, who is against that proposal, 
      asked US officials to enforce existing immigration laws. 
 
In our 
      7:30 half hour former CIA director George Tenet spoke 
      to Harry about his new book, "At The Center of The 
      Storm".
Tenet 
      once again criticized the Bush Administration for its handling of 
      the Iraq war. 
 
Financial expert Dave Ramsey was here to answer your questions on getting your financial house in order. Johan  Otter and  his daughter 
      Jenna survived a grizzly 
      bear attack and joined us today to talk about that 
      horrifying ordeal. Dave Price played a game 
      of Harry Potter trivia with the folks out on our plaza. We saw some cool 
      new sunglasses that are now available just in time for the Spring sun 
      and game show icon Chuck Barris came by the studio to talk 
      about his new book. 
 
On tomorrow's show, we're looking forward to hearing from our 
      friend Capitol Bob -- Bob Schieffer, 
      that is -- and also from London correspondent Mark Phillips, who'll 
      be filling us in on Queen Elizabeth II's visit to the U.S. this weekend. 
      She'll be here to commemorate the 400th anniversary of the first English 
      settlement in America and she'll also take in the Kentucky Derby. 
      
Take care,
 
      


Russ 
      Mitchell
